alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:12PM EST until January 11 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Rawlings affecting Brunswick and Dinwiddie Counties. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River at Rawlings. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, River comes out of its banks in the vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:05 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 10.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 08/04/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EST.
